intro: Dipteracanthus confinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and are borne in dense inflorescences, often in the axils of the leaves. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
